quotes.quote: Art is pattern informed by sensibility.
Finding patterns is the essence of wisdom.
When patterns are broken, new worlds emerge.
One should never mistake pattern for meaning.
All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
Each human is uniquely different. Like snowflakes, the human pattern is never cast twice.
Strategy is a pattern in a stream of decisions.
Creativeness is finding patterns where none exist.
Time is an encoded pattern of fabric woven with information & energy.
Self-destructive patterns cause as much suffering as outer catastrophes.
The patterns we perceive are determined by the stories we want to believe.
The pattern of the narrative never of necessity wants to end, it never has to.
A pattern is either right or wrong...it is no stronger than its weakest point.
The habit patterns of the human mind are very strong and make it seem that the hard way is easy and the easy way is hard.
Metaphor is not just the detection of patterns; it is the creation of patterns.
When information overload occurs, pattern recognition is how to determine truth.
One of the deepest habitual patterns that we have is to feel that now is not enough.
All is pattern, all life, but we can't always see the pattern when we're part of it.
Patterns exist in our seemingly patternless lives, and the most common pattern is the circle.
Human beings are pattern-seeking animals who will prefer even a bad theory or a conspiracy theory to no theory at all.
What we call chaos is just patterns we haven’t recognized. What we call random is just patterns we can't decipher.
The suppression of inner patterns in favor of patterns created by society is dangerous to us.
Every human life had its pattern that had to be worked out slowly to its ultimate conclusion.
When we can't see a pattern, we fit pieces together until one takes shape, because we have to.
Mathematics is the science of patterns, and nature exploits just about every pattern that there is.
Successful people follow successful patterns.
Clouds float in the same pattern only once.
Be a pattern to others and then all will go well.
No pattern should be without some sort of meaning.
Our biggest failure is our failure to see patterns.
